sentences.en: Already, both sides are jockeying to belittle the other side.
sentences.cn: 双方已经在使出浑身解数贬低对方了。

sentences.en: Do not belittle what he has achieved.
sentences.cn: 不能小看他取得的成绩.

sentences.en: Don't belittle her piano playing just because you're jealous.
sentences.cn: 不要仅仅因为你忌妒而贬低她的钢琴弹奏.

sentences.en: Don't belittle yourself, ie Don't be too modest about your abilities or achievements.
He tends to belittle her efforts.
I find it belittle to be reprimanded by someone so much younger than me.
sentences.cn: 我觉得,被这麽个比我年龄小得多的人训斥,真太失身分了.

sentences.en: It is wrong to belittle or neglect popularization.
sentences.cn: 轻视和忽视普及工作的态度是错误的.

sentences.en: It makes no sense to belittle the enormity of the disaster which has occurred.
sentences.cn: 对于已经发生的灾难，其严重性不该小视。

sentences.en: Keep away from people who belittle your ambitions.
sentences.cn: 躲开贬低你的雄心的人.

sentences.en: Only those above me can praise or belittle me.
sentences.cn: 只有那些在我之上的人才能称赞我或轻视我.

sentences.en: This is not to belittle the enormous progress in the development of refractories.
sentences.cn: 这并非是小看耐火材料发展中的巨大进步.

sentences.en: We mustn't belittle her outstanding achievement.
sentences.cn: 我们一定不能小瞧了她所取得的杰出成就。

sentences.en: When you belittle others, you are actually the one who appears small.
sentences.cn: 当你轻视他人时, 真正渺小的其实是你自己.

words.tran_cn: 轻视的；小看的；有失身份的
轻视；贬低（belittle的ing形式）；使相形见绌

trans.tran_en: to make someone or something seem small or unimportant
to make someone or something seem small or unimportant
